## isPublishedIdEqual() function

Checks if the document ID `documentId` has the same published ID as `equalsDocumentId`<!-- -->, ignoring any draft or version prefix.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare function isPublishedIdEqual(
  documentId: DocumentId,
  candidateId: DocumentId,
): boolean
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

documentId


</td><td>

[DocumentId](./id-utils.documentid.md)


</td><td>

The document ID to check


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

candidateId


</td><td>

[DocumentId](./id-utils.documentid.md)


</td><td>

The document ID to check against


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
**Returns:**

boolean

`true` if the document IDs are equal, `false` otherwise

## Example 1

Draft vs published document ID, but representing the same document:

```
// Prints "true":
console.log(isPublishedIdEqual('drafts.foo', 'foo'));
```

## Example 2

Version vs published document ID, but representing the same document:

```
// Prints "true":
console.log(isPublishedIdEqual('versions.xyz.foo', 'foo'));
```

## Example 3

Different documents:

```
// Prints "false":
console.log(isPublishedIdEqual('foo', 'bar'));
```
